Description.Content: Provides support for building custom scene changes.
Manages the set of transitions that fire when there is a change of Scene.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
A transition between an originating scene to the destination scene.
The originating scene in this scene change.
The destination scene in this scene change.
The id of a transition to be used in a particular scene change.
Manages the set of transitions that fire when there is a change of Scene.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
Amount of time (in milliseconds) that the transition should run.
Interpolator to be used in the animations spawned by this transition.
Delay in milliseconds before the transition starts.
The match order to use for the transition. This is a comma-separated list of values, containing one or more of the following: id, itemId, name, instance.
Takes a set of target tags, each of which lists a specific targetId, targetClass, targetName, excludeId, excludeClass, or excludeName, which this transition acts upon.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
The fully-qualified name of the Class to exclude from this transition.
The id of a target to exclude from this transition.
The transitionName of the target to exclude from this transition.
The fully-qualified name of the Class to include in this transition.
The id of a target on which this transition will animate changes.
The transitionName of the target on which this transition will animation changes.
A TransitionSet is a parent of child transitions (including other TransitionSets). Using TransitionSets enables more complex choreography of transitions.
A PathMotion that generates a curved path along an arc on an imaginary circle containing the two points.
The maximum arc angle in degrees between the start and end points.
The minimum arc angle in degrees between the start and end points when they are close to horizontal.
The minimum arc angle in degrees between the start and end points when they are close to vertical.

This base class can be extended to provide motion along a Path to Transitions. Transitions such as ChangeBounds move Views, typically in a straight path between the start and end positions. Applications that desire to have these motions move in a curve can change how Views interpolate in two dimensions by extending PathMotion and implementing getPath(float, float, float, float).
The custom class to instantiate that describes the pathMotion.

A PathMotion that takes a Path pattern and applies it to the separation between two points. The starting point of the Path will be moved to the origin and the end point will be scaled and rotated so that it matches with the target end point.
The path string describing the pattern to use for the PathPathMotion.
Captures the layout bounds of target views before and after the scene change and animates those changes during the transition.
Resize the view by adjusting the clipBounds rather than changing the dimensions of the view itself. The default value is false.
ChangeClipBounds captures the getClipBounds() before and after the scene change and animates those changes during the transition.
Captures an ImageView's matrix before and after the scene change and animates it during the transition.
Captures the scroll properties of targets before and after the scene change and animates any changes.
Captures the scroll properties of targets before and after the scene change and animates any changes.
This transition tracks changes to the visibility of target views in the start and end scenes.
Changes whether the transition supports appearing and/or disappearing Views.
Only appearing Views will be supported.
Only disappearing Views will be supported.

Tracks changes to the visibility of target views in the start and end scenes and moves views in or out from the edges of the scene. Visibility is determined by both the setVisibility(int) state of the view as well as whether it is parented in the current view hierarchy. Disappearing Views are limited as described in onDisappear(android.view.ViewGroup, TransitionValues, int, TransitionValues, int). Views move away from the focal View or the center of the Scene if no epicenter was provided.
Tracks changes to the visibility of target views in the start and end scenes and fades views in or out when they become visible or non-visible.
The behavior of this transition, a combination of IN and OUT.
The view fades in.
The view fades in and out.
The view fades out.
Tracks changes to the visibility of target views in the start and end scenes and moves views in or out from one of the edges of the scene.
The edge of the scene to use for Views appearing and disappearing.
Push object to x-axis position at the start of its container, not changing its size.
Push object to x-axis position at the end of its container, not changing its size.
Push object to the bottom of its container, not changing its size.
Push object to the top of its container, not changing its size.
Push object to the left of its container, not changing its size.
Push object to the right of its container, not changing its size.
